title: Emma Corrin emulates Princess Diana during her tour of Australia while filming season 4 of The Crown
text:
She is set to make her debut as Princess Diana in the forthcoming fourth series of The Crown.

And Emma Corrin transformed into the late royal during her 1983 tour of Australia, as she filmed scenes for the Netflix drama in Malaga, Spain, with her co-star Josh O'Connor who will be playing Prince Charles, for the new series on Monday.

The rising star, 23 donned a pink polka dot dress, which was almost a carbon copy of the one Diana wore at the time while visiting the Freemantle Hospital, near Perth.

Uncanny: Emma Corrin transformed into the late Lady Diana Spencer during her 1983 tour of Australia, as she filmed scenes in Malaga, Spain, for the latest series on Monday

The designers of the dress paid heavy attention to detail, as the garment featured a cinched waist and twisted detailing around the high neckline, similar to Diana's.

Emma's frock was teamed with a pair of understated white court shoes and an oversized white envelope clutch bag, which she carried in her hand.

She accessorised with a delicate gold chain bracelet and a pair of simple yet elegant pair of pearl studded earrings.

The actress also wore a garland of white and pink flowers around her neck, which were likely a welcome gift when she arrived at the hospital.

Mirror image: The rising star, 23 donned a pink polka dot dress, which was almost a carbon copy of the one Diana wore at the time while visiting the Freemantle Hospital, near Perth (pictured)

Unlike Diana's dress, which was originally designed by Donald Campbell, Emma's version boasted pink rather than white polka dots and also had a sequined sheen.

In between takes, Diana was able to stay composed as she was shielded from the rays by a member of the crew who was holding a huge black umbrella.

At the time of the trip Diana would have been just 22 and it was her first tour with her eldest son William, who would have been nine months old at the time.

Elsewhere, Josh mimicked the look of Prince Charles by wearing a smart grey suit as he greeted fans in the crowd who were waving Australia and Union Jack flags.

Spot on: The designers of the dress paid heavy attention to detail, as the garment featured a cinched waist and twisted detailing around the high neckline, similar to Diana's

On Thursday, the duo were pictured filming scenes which appeared to be from Prince Charles and Diana's visit to the Sydney Opera House.

This was the second time fans have had a glimpse of Emma in the role of Diana, after her casting was announced earlier in the year.

Screen star Emma was finally unveiled as the actress portraying the much-loved princess, after much speculation about who might be taking on the part.

The TV and film star kicked off filming in the European country alongside Prince Charles actor Josh in late September, just over a month ahead of the show's hotly-anticipated series three premiere.

Welcome! The actress also wore a garland of white and pink flowers around her neck, which were likely a welcome gift when she arrived at the hospital

Baby's first tour: The Australian tour was Charles and Diana's first with baby Prince William (pictured at Alice Springs airport on March 1983)

The scenes shot in Spain will mirror the Prince and Princess of Wales, along with William, when they spent 41 days travelling to Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and Bondi Beach.

Prince Charles actor Josh, 29, has been working on the Netflix series already, as his character appears in season three, which drops on the streaming site next month.

Josh shot Charles' investiture scene at Caernarfon Castle in November last year, alongside his on-screen parents Olivia Colman (Queen Elizabeth II) and Tobias Menzies (Duke of Edinburgh).

Twice as nice: Diana rewore the look at the Sunshine Coach Lunch for the Variety Club of Great Britain New Bus Appeal at the Guildhall in London, July 1983 (pictured)

Shortly after it was announced that she would be playing Diana, Emma took to social media, looking slightly overwhelmed with the media attention she has received since her casting was announced earlier this year.

Referencing the spotlight she now finds herself under, Emma shared a snap of her bewildered expression while she stood above various tabloids, opened to the generally positive news of her casting as the tragic Princess.

Captioning the shot, the Cesare star wrote: ‘What a week! Thank you for the love!'

The Crown Season 3 launches globally on Sunday, November 17
